intro: Allosorus alabamensis, commonly known as the Alabama rockcress, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. This perennial herb typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in open woodlands or along stream banks. Its small, white flowers bloom in early spring, and it produces small, rounded seed pods that contain numerous tiny seeds. The plant is noted for its adaptability to various environmental conditions and is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
